name: places/ChIJa75ZHbRZwokRQSoJ5DgeycU
formattedAddress: 10 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 10 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001-1411, USA

originalText.text:
Leña's cooks are experts at Wood-fired cooking. From, delicate mussels to dry aged steaks, and paellas, they expertly prepare delicious food.

And their mushroom paella has no right being that good. How can a vegetarian dish be so flavorful?

text.text:
Leña's cooks are experts at Wood-fired cooking. From, delicate mussels to dry aged steaks, and paellas, they expertly prepare delicious food.

And their mushroom paella has no right being that good. How can a vegetarian dish be so flavorful?

originalText.text:
It is kinda cool to watch them cook on the fires, which is what they are known for.

The grilled octopus was average, it was juicy but lacked flavor I think.

The ribeye burger was good, I loved the touch of pickled green peppers, but the taste can definitely be strong! The sides of the patty was super crunchy.

The iberico pork top shoulder cut was interesting, it didn’t really taste like pork (as our waitress had told us) - the consistency was kinda like steak.

Service was really great here.

originalText.text:
The overall experience at the market was a 10+. We traveled out of state to visit El Mercado and we LOVED IT. The atmosphere, the theme, everything was spot on and impecable. We made reservations for La Leña for lunch and this was without doubt one of the best gastronomic experiences of my life! Our waiter DAVID was just phenomenal. He made our experience exquisite. He understood our preferences immediately and helped us to make the right dishes selection. He made sure we all felt comfortable, especially he made sure my parents had everything they needed. True definition of service excellence!
From the appetizers to the main dishes to the dessert ALL plates were an indulgence to our senses. We had Pan con tomate, Croquetas de jamón,  Piquillos, Paella Valenciana (made right in front of us), Cochinillo, Arroz con leche, pastel de queso, arroz con leche, ….and every single dish was fresh, carefully made and just delicious. In summary a great experience and atmosphere.

originalText.text:
I was lured in by pictures of their burger while walking through the Spanish market. When I looked at the menu and saw the price tag of the burger I was somewhat skeptical. But I decided to take a shot at the $32 burger. I figured either they're very proud of their food or it really is that good. Turns out that the burger was indeed, hands down, the best burger I have ever tasted. The patty is made from a 60 day dry aged ribeye topped with cheese and some tasty sauces. The server recommended I take it medium rare, which I did. The fries, also expensive were pretty tasty as well. The jury is still out on whether the burger was worth the asking price, but it sure as hell is the best burger I've ever had. The service was a bit lack lustre. The server came across as rather arrogant, probably because I was in my work clothes, and he didn't check on me once during my meal. A second server cleared the table and finally brought me the bill, perhaps I showed up in the middle of a shift change.

Well, I returned and this time I brought my wife. We both had the burger and dessert. As expected the food was top notch and the desserts were too die for. Unlike my first time here, our waiter did a phenomenal job. I'm starting to think the food is definitely worth it.

originalText.text: We got the paella with rabbit and chicken, and the first few bites were great. But it became so heavy and greasy and the food cooled down. It felt very overpriced, especially for the small portion but the vibe of the space is an experience.
